para.text: The infiltration rate in the top layer of the model is 0.1 m/d. However, in columns 15 to 25, there will be solute associated with the infiltration so use a separate object to specify it.We will edit the object layer to add the solute. There must also be a separate object covering the remainder of the grid to specify the steady UZF properties but with an infiltration rate of 0.
You will set the following steady UZF properties for all the objects.

image.title: Screen capture of the Object Properties dialog box showing the specification of the steady UZF properties.
image.caption: Screen capture of the Object Properties dialog box showing the specification of the steady UZF properties.

para.text: For the objects in the top layer specify a flow rate of 0.1

image.title: Screen capture of the Object Properties dialog box showing the specification of the infiltration rate.
image.caption: Screen capture of the Object Properties dialog box showing the specification of the infiltration rate.

para.text: Try coloring the grid with the UZF infiltration rate and ensure that the infiltration rate is set correctly. If the infiltration rate for the top of the grid is not 0.1, try sending the object that specifies the UZF properties for the other layers of the grid to the back of the list of objects by selecting it, right-clicking, and selecting "To Back" from the popup menu.
